fields.description:
A Cross sites scripting vulnerability exists in macro used to render the 'printable' link.

Here is an exploit for the vulnerability that works

https://servername/wiki/display/a/2007/09/%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert('Watchfire%20XSS%20Test%20Successful')%3C/script%3E

Bug was found using APPScan.
fields.summary: XSS Bug in printable link display

fields.description:
Found while debugging a failing test. 

If your search includes inactive users (e.g. that have no roles), then they are not displayed in the list result, which is correct. However, the summary line "found X users" does include those inactive users. So you can have the result of no users getting displayed, but the summary line claiming there is one user.

See screenshot for bug and for how a fix should look like.
fields.summary: Mismatch in People Search: Inactive users are not displayed, but show up in the summary line

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce;

# Log in as a registered user
# Click add page
# Add a viewing restriction to a group on the add page screen
# Save the page

Result:

The page shows up as created by anonymous

Expected result:

The page should show up as being added by the logged in user

The last edited by attribution works however so this may just be a template/value bean problem.
fields.summary: Pages created with restrictions show as created by Anonymous

fields.description:
Hi,

Our Theme Builder plugin now contains lots of icon resources in both GIF and PNG format - as a result, it's gone up to about 4MB total file size.

Our beta testers have often hit the max-packet size issue - is there any way that it can be increased by default to 4MB or is that setting something on the JVM?

When uploading large attachments, this issue doesn't seem to occur - it's only plugins that cause the problem.

Note: All the icons are optional - we just wanted to give clients more too choose from.
fields.summary: Problems installing BIG plugins :)

fields.description: When an attachment download URL is accessed with a non-numeric attachment id a {{NumberFormatException}} is thrown. This causes unnecessary traffic in the server logs for a client error. We should change this so that a 404 is returned and no exception.
fields.summary: Accessing an invalid attachment download URL causes exception

fields.description:
The server.xml file in the stand-alone distribution contains this attribute:

{code}
    <Service name="Tomcat-Standalone">
        <Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector" port="80" minProcessors="5"
                   maxProcessors="75"
                   enableLookups="true" redirectPort="8444" acceptCount="10" debug="0" connectionTimeout="20000"
                   useURIValidationHack="false" URIEncoding="UTF-8"/>
{code}

The redirectPort should be 8443.
fields.summary: Connector redirect port in server.xml should be 8443, not 8444

fields.description:
Jira, Crowd and Confluence run on separate servers in our setup.

The {jiraissues} macro creates a page with links to localhost. Oke, this is know as a feature of the macro, so I added the baseurl option as described in the documentation.
To no effect!

The following macro does not work:

{jiraissues:url=https://<JIRA_BASE>/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&pid=10120&resolution=-1&fixfor=10291&sorter/field=priority&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1000&os_username=<CROWD_ACCOUNT>&os_password=<CROWD_PASSWORD>|https://<JIRA_BASE>}

It creates the page, but all links contain localhost instead of https://<JIRA_BASE>
fields.summary: jiraissues macro does not work with alternate base url in our setup

fields.description:
I just did a very brief check, but it seems to me that there are occurences where the loglevel of information is set too low.

For example, I would expect a scheduled job always to announce its start and end to the INFO level, so that I will know later on that this job was actually running when something weird happens.

Check those files for example

fields.description:
Hello,

I tried to build my company's Confluence plugins against Confluence 2.5.7 but the process failed due to missing atlassian-core 2.6 on http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/repository/maven2/com/atlassian/core/atlassian-core/

Please upload atlassian-core 2.6 so that plugins can be built using Confluence 2.5.7 poms. Relevant snippet of Maven output follows.

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] BUILD ERROR
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Failed to resolve artifact.

Missing:
----------
1) atlassian-core:atlassian-core:jar:2.6

  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.

  Then, install it using the command: 
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=atlassian-core -DartifactId=atlassian-core \
          -Dversion=2.6 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file
Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there:       mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=atlassian-core -DartifactId=atlassian-core \
          -Dversion=2.6 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file \
           -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]

  Path to dependency: 
        1) itella:itella-confluence-export:atlassian-plugin:1.0.0
        2) com.atlassian.confluence:confluence:jar:2.5.7
        3) com.atlassian.bucket:atlassian-bucket:jar:0.11
        4) atlassian-core:atlassian-core:jar:2.6

----------
1 required artifact is missing.

for artifact: 
  itella:itella-confluence-export:atlassian-plugin:1.0.0

from the specified remote repositories:
  atlassian-m2-contrib (http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/repository/maven2),
  atlassian-m2-repository (http://repository.atlassian.com/maven2),
  central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2)
fields.summary: Atlassian maven repository out of date for Confluence 2.5.7

fields.description:
Some exceptions are logged with logger.error("bla-bla"+e) instead of logger.error("bla-bla",e): I ran a simple search for all usages for Category.error(Object o), and found several occasions where the exception is logged as a string instead of a proper exception. This means that if the exception occurs, no stracktrace will be printed, which makes it difficult to track problems. 


In other places, no logging was done at all. See

/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/MailDatabaseUpgradeTask.java 

for example. In case of an error, the code should report that, not silently swallow the exception

We have to go through the code and find and fix as many of these problems, since they will come and haunt us at some point.
fields.summary: Logfiles: Incomplete and missing logging of exceptions

fields.description:
Whenever I want to link to, say \[SPACE:Page Title], I _always_ end up writing it as \[Page Title|SPACE:Page Title] because the default formatting for that link is ugly. We should fix links so that the default display is more readable and less markup-y.

SPC:Page Title -> Page Title
/2004/12/1/Blog Post -> Blog Post
SPC:Page Title#anchor -> Page Title#anchor (not sure about this one? Leave as it is for now)
Page^attachment.pdf -> attachment.pdf
fields.summary: Clean up default link bodies for "raw" links.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9443].
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian update - March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone

Thank you for your comments and for following this issue. We’ve noticed that this has been raised as both a suggestion CONFSERVER-9443 and as a bug CONFSERVER-59931.

The main causes for the images not rendering properly are all related to the fact that in order to view attachments in Confluence, the user has to be authorised:

the user viewing the email message is not logged in
the user's email client doesn't allow for a session to be set up with Confluence for authentication purposes
the user’s email client no longer has access to the attached image
the configured outgoing mail server caches images, but is unable to authorise in Confluence, and caches the 403 responses (e.g. when Gmail with the default settings is used as the outgoing mail server).
While we don’t have plans to address this currently, we will update this suggestion to be a bug as we understand that images not being viewable in the emails is not an ideal experience and can be confusing for the mail recipient. We’ll also update the linked issues and the description.

Thanks

Makisa | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server and Data Center
{panel}

h3. Summary

Images are not shown in email notifications.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Integrate Confluence with a Mail Server
 # Create a test user and ensure that you are watching a space. Additionally, edit the user profile settings to ensure that your mail subscriptions/email settings will ensure that you will be notified for updates.
 # Log in as an admin or another test user and create a blog post OR page with no restrictions in the space that your other test user watches so that they will receive an email notification.

h3. Expected behaviour

The email notification would show the attached image.
h3. Actual results

The notification does not display the image attached. You are able to see the content (text) of the notification email but the images are broken. Page is secured with page permissions, so requires a login to view. The images which aren't displayed are attachments on the page. Logging in with Safari and selecting "Remember me" doesn't make a difference.
h3. Notes

The image URLs are the correct relative URLs, but the HTML has a <base> tag in the header.
h3. Workaround

If you're using Google Apps for your organisation you may want to check [Google Support|https://support.google.com/a/answer/3299041?hl=en]. Information is provided for how you can whitelist your Confluence/JIRA base URL to allow it to show embedded images. This is unrelated to mixed http/https content and should be independent of the browser used.
fields.summary: Embedded images not shown in email notifications due to login requirement

fields.description:
I created a feed for the entire space, including all possible updates (the sanitized link is below). Our home page has {recently-updated} tag. Every time some other page is updated, I get two items in the feed: for the change and for the home page (with no changes of course). Moreover, I get updates for the home page for no reason several (less than ten) times a day.

http://withheld/createrssfeed.action?types=page&types=blogpost&types=mail&types=comment&types=attachment&statuses=created&statuses=modified&spaces=withheld&labelString=&rssType=atom&maxResults=256&timeSpan=16&publicFeed=true&title=Wiki
fields.summary: RSS feed erroneously shows page as updated if it has {recently-updated} or {calendar} tag

fields.description:
Users without the global access right for personal space can still see links to personal spaces in the "Recently updated" list on their dashboard.
This is a serious security problem for extranets, when one wants to prevent *non anonymous* external users to see who's using the wiki.

Note: this problem as been reported previously in a [comment here on CONF-7837|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7837#action_80585].
fields.summary: Recently updated links for users with personal spaces link to profile if personal space is not accessible

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Perform an edit on a page and supply a version comment.
# View this page's version history.
# Select a version before the recent edit and revert the page to this version.

Confluence will create a new version of the page with the contents of the version you have just reverted to.

The new page will *incorrectly* have the version comment from the most recent edit.  

The correct behavior would be either:
# a generated comment ("Page Reverted from Version X")
# no comment at all
# a user entered comment as part of the revert
fields.summary: Incorrect Version Comment Behaviour when Reverting a Page to an old Version

fields.description:
This patch fixes problems with transitive dependencies and upgrades Confluence to the most recent of the Atlassian common modules.

Wikiexporter JTidy encoding change has been tested by exporting a PDF page with Japanese characters.

Please review, change and commit for the Confluence 2.7 dev cycle.
fields.summary: Upgrade Atlassian Common modules for Confluence 2.7

fields.description:
Tony asked for a way to provide the location of the log files to the customer, and will create a page on CAC for all of the project.

However, while researching the documentation of Confluence, Sam found that there was no documentation for this in the original Confluence documentation. If this is the case (or if the documentation is there but kind of hidden), we should improve the situation.


Mail1 from Sam:


Logs for Confluence:

* Standalone: CONFLUENCE_INSTALL/logs, main log file is called atlassian-confluence.log
* EAR/WAR: logs are going to the console, so it will use the default logging files of the application container.

Mail2 from Sam:

I believe yesterday I sent you the information of where to find the logs. Not a page where you could find this information. I can't seem to find one. I believe there is not a single page with this information but it is spread in different pages...
fields.summary: Document (better) where the log files can be located

fields.description:
Problem: 
When upgrading from a 2.2.x version to a 2.5.x version, the configuration info (Administration -> General Configuration) does not appear to restore correctly. After restarting Confluence, it appears. 

Steps to replicate:
1) Install 2.2.10
2) Modify general configuration
3) Create backup
4) Restore on 2.5.7 
5) Check general configuration

Assessment:
It appears that this may be due to configuration info being stored in the xml file confluence-global.bandana.xml as opposed to on the BANDANA table in later versions. This info is not reloaded into active memory.

Workaround:
After restoring backup, go to Administration, Cache Statistics, and click 'Flush all'.
fields.summary: Bandana cache not flushed when site backup restored

fields.description:
- Using the name "Something, else" for an external group as a 'page restriction' (view or edit) will not find the ldap group, even if it exists in LDAP, reporting 'invlaid user or group name(s): something, else"
- same behavior for "Something\, else" with an escape before the comma
- using the group chooser (choose groups) with "something, else" finds "something, else", which can be checked and 'select group(s) chosen.
- this creates two new 'restriction' entries in the form, one called "Something\" (a backslash at the end) and one called "else".
- strangely, saving these two restrictions results in a restriction to "something,else" (no space in the name) which doesn't exist.and a restriction to the author. Both can be removed normally.
fields.summary: Using a comma in a name for an group on a page restriction fails

fields.description:
I'm currently wading through Conf 2.6-dr1 main-action.css as part of the QA process for Theme Builder 3.0 - prior versions of our theme didn't include main-action.css but instead used a much trimmed-down version to reduce download times and make it easier for theme designers to add their own CSS without constantly "undoing" styles set by the main-action.css. However, With Confluence 2.6 and Builder 3.0 we decided to start using main-action.css again as it's now much cleaner.

There are however, some items that could be cleaned up and I will create sub-tasks to this issue to list them. This process will likely take me several days as there's a LOT of CSS in there hehe.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.6-dr1 main-action.css tweaks

fields.description:
this is for page restrictions, not space permissions

*Situation*
We recently upgraded to 2.5.7 from 2.3.3
- all of our page restrictions in 2.3.3 seemed to be able to select both LDAP group aliases OR display names.
- now, several groups can no longer be found in the 'lookup group' dialog unless they are searched for by their display name
- these same groups, if assigned to pages, cannot be accessed by anyone. 

For example, a LDAP group named "Alpha" with an alias "A" was used. Now in the space restrictions, we see a restriction on page X to group A, but no one, not even members of group A, can access the page. If we as admins remove the page restrictions, and try to add group A, we cannot find it. We can now add group 'ALPHA' and everything works as expected.

- We have a legacy of many pages that are restricted using the group alias, not the display name.  Save removing all restrictions as they are encountered, we have no mechanism to qucikly re-map these restrictions.

- in our environment at least, the alias is more stable, as it doesn't change often, while the display name may change (in the external LDAP environment), potentially making 'restricted' pages suddenly no longer restricted.
fields.summary: Page Restrictions in 2.5.7 now use LDAP Display Name rather than LDAP alias, as used in 2.3.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9417].
  {panel}

The following icons have a solid white background making it difficult to style the recently-updated macro using CSS (eg. if I want gradient backgrounds, etc):

/images/icons/arrow_down.png
/images/icons/arrow_right.png

Also, the icon used for the green "+" image used to denote links to missing wiki pages (ie. clicking them will create the page) have a solid white background instead of a transparent background.

Hrm, speaking of that image, the green "+" is missing from such links in 2.6-dr1!

Ideally the icons should be 16 colour (or less) GIF 89a non-interlaced format (they don't need alpha-transparency, just a single transparency colour) which will also reduce their filesize slightly.
fields.summary: twixie arrow icon on recently-updated doesn't have transparent background

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9416].
  {panel}

We've added a nifty new feature in Theme Builder 3.0 which allows theme colours to be either statically set (in the layout manager) or dynamically set (in which case they are taken from the Confluence "Colour Scheme").

Unfortunately, when the Confluence "colour scheme" is changed, there's no event triggered so we can't make our theme layouts change the timestamp in the CSS URLs to force the browser to reload the CSS (we use "cache expire" so that CSS is never reloaded unless something changes).

Is there any chance that a new event could be added to Confluence that will trigger when the colour scheme is changed? It would need to include the space key if the colour scheme is changed at space level or just empty if global level?

I've attached a collage of some of the cool effects that we can now do in Builder 3.0 simply by altering the Confluence colour scheme - no graphics were changed, just the "top bar" and "menu bar" colours :) It's just a shame that the end-user has to clear their browser cache (or the theme designer has to make a "fake" change to their layout) to force the CSS to be re-loaded after the colours are changed.

Guy
fields.summary: Trigger event when Confluence "colour scheme" is changed

fields.description:
If global permission is set to not allow anyone to have personal spaces, confluence-administrators should not be presented with opportunity to create personal space, which is currently showing up in a blue info box on their profile page and in a "Create Personal Space" link to the right on their profile page.

In global configuration the permission to create a personal space is revoked, so it would appear this is a bug.
fields.summary: If global permission is set to not allow anyone to have personal spaces, confluence-administrators should not be presented with opportunity to create personal space in their profile

fields.description:
Documentation for these macros was added to the notation guide in CONF-7621, but as far as I can tell, they still aren't documented on CAC.

We should document these macros. It should just be a matter of grabbing the relevant section from the notation guide (or from CONF-7621, where Agnes seems to have pasted it in a comment.)
fields.summary: Document activity plugin macros in Confluence manual

fields.description:
Dear all,

1.
we have 1.9 GB attachment data.
After migration of the attachments from the filesystem approach to the recommended database approach no backup is running any more: we get allways Java  heap space errors. When using filesystem as storage location backup is successful. 
The database approach is recommended by Atlassian and it is necessary for cluster architecure and upgrade to another master release version.

2. 
when once switched to database storage approach of attachments  no switch back to filesystem storage (1.9 GB data)

Chears,

Stefan
fields.summary: Backup fails when attachments (1.9 GB) stored in external (MySQL) database

fields.description:
(Copied and pasted from Benjamin Naftzger [Atlassian] under CONF-8704, relogged as a bug since it is unexpected behaviour causing loss of work)

This applies to the Image-popup which apparently only gets triggered from the wysiwyg-editor. 

I was wondering why attaching images was failing, however it turns out we just have some rather poorly designed UI. 

When you go to add an image to an existing page, the course of action that I attempted (wanted) was to:

1. Browse and select an image to attach
2. Click ok
3. See my image attached to the page

Instead, the attach file / browse operation is presented in the middle of the screen. If I click on this and click ok, I am presented with an alert that I need to enter a filename (which also means we have two fields on the one screen referring to filenames (one remote and one local) which could be deemed as confusing and not friendly for business users). This in itself is slightly annoying and should be improved by resolving CONF-6597.

But the absolute _worst_ thing is that, if you then click OK, it closes the window and displays a broken image icon in the rich text editor.

The problem, is due to the fact that there is another button called "Attach", which must be clicked, before clicking "OK".

Also, the Attach File 'Browse' operation should be at the top of the screen, given that this is what you are actually trying to do. You want to work out which file to attach and then just attach it so no doubt this should be prioritised to the top of the screen.
fields.summary: Image-attachment popup design causes image attachments to fail

#  Add confluence-administrators to Groups

#  Click Save All.

Attached a screen shot with the Clickr theme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9398].
  {panel}

Currently the two choices for match-labels are "all" and "any".  "All" matches content labeled with all of the labels identified (with an AND operator) and "Any" matches any of the specified labels (with an OR operator).

I'm proposing to add syntax for noting label(s) to exclude from the list.  

Take for example:
blog post #1: labels=foo,bar
blog post #2: labels=foo,confluence
blog post #3: labels=bar,jira

the syntax may be something like:
{blog-posts:10|labels=confluence|match-labels=none}

The resulting list would then include blog post #1 and #3, but would exclude #2.
fields.summary: Suggesting to add negative matching syntax to match-labels

I stuck a breakpoint in, and at the Axis level, the SOAP looks like:

PI91mFTnK6</in0>

Comment</comment>

fields.description:
Confluence's "remember me" tickbox doesn't work if the login page is secure, but the rest of the application is unsecured.

Seraph's CookieUtils.setCookie() method create a secure cookie ([ref|http://www.apps.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2965.html#page-7]) if the request had a secure URL, and this cookie isn't sent by the client to a non-secure address.

The solution to this ticket is to upgrade Confluence to use Seraph to 0.10 or later.
fields.summary: Option to disable "secure" cookie when using HTTPS just for login page

fields.description:
The decorator page layouts for some of the documentation spaces are customised, to show the left-hand pagetree navigation panel. 

Because of the custom decorator, the new Confluence 2.6 decorator is not applied. This causes GUI problems:
* On a page, the View, Edit, Info and Attachments tabs are shown as a vertical bulleted list instead of tabs.
* Comments do not show properly

*Fix:* Apply the Default Page Layout, then re-insert the custom code.

Apply the fix to the following spaces on CAC:
* CROWD010
* CROWD
* CLOVER
* CSH
* BAMBOO
* BAMBOO10
* BAMBOO011
fields.summary: CAC document spaces for Crowd, Confluence Hosted, Clover and Bamboo - fix decorator page layouts

fields.description:
Currently the invite plugin allows only site administrators or site users to create invitations. There are 2 problems with the 'site users' configuration:

1) Site users can invite users to any group in the space, including confluence-administrators (if they are one of the groups in the space)
2) Any users who have as little as view permission can invite

The request would be either:
1) A simple fix: prevent a user from inviting to a group to which that user does not belong.
2) add fine-grained control to specify which users can invite, and which groups they can be invited to. This should be configurable from the general settings.

To replicate the issue:
1) Add confluence-administrators to space permission. Give them any set of permissions. 
2) Install invite plugin. Configure it to allow space-users to invite.
3) Go to Advanced tab in Browse Space. Select Invite users. Click the groups drop-down; the confluence-administrators group is visible.
fields.summary: Fine grained permissions for invite plugin configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9387].
  {panel}

Currently it is possible for users with create comments permission to embed macros in these comments.

This is a security risk and unnecessary/unwanted feature. 

Should a macro contain security vulnerability, we can't rely on the fact that only trusted users whom we given permission to create/edit wiki pages could misuse them, because even users with create comment permission whom we don't trust can use macros in comments.

There is a short list of basic macros that should be allowed in comments to let users better format their comments. This list includes:   quote, code, and basic formating macros (bold, italics, ordered and unordered list)

If you wanted to make the behavior very flexible and make confluence backwards compatible for users who already rely on macros in comments, you could externalize the exception list as a JVM property or a property stored in the DB.
fields.summary: Only allow basic formatting macros in comments
Anchors for headings wrapped in {color} macros are not correct, breaks Table of Contents {toc} macro

fields.description:
Please see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CWDSUP-323 for details.

Summary: By having the group "confluence-administrators" hardwired we can not partition administrative rights when using multiple confluence instances and CROWD.
The administrative group is currently hardwired into confluence. This design leaves some room for improvement ;-)
Suggestion: Make the administrative (superuser) group (which is currently confluence-administrators) configurable, so that we can have things like
service.confluence-adminsitrators and topsecretprojects.confluence-administrators.

This is critical for us as we can not do the integration without (see the CROWD ticket for details)
fields.summary: Please make the administrative group configurable, drop the hardwired "confluence-administrators"

fields.description:
Investigate the customer's comment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enable+user+access+logging?focusedCommentId=86474797#comment-86474797
and update the page if necessary.
fields.summary: Documentation - customer's comment on page 'Enable user access logging'

fields.description: Reorganise the way beans are divided between spring files to make inter-dependencies of components clearer, to make it easier to build minimal testing contexts, and so on...
fields.summary: Organise spring config files more sanely

fields.description:
Some Confluence plugins listed in the Confluence Extension space have not been updated by the author in years and are unusable on supported editions of Confluence. Broken third-party plugins can hurt the apparent reliability of Confluence, so we should contact the author and test the plugin, then move any dead plugins into a plugin graveyard space. We should also request information on each plugin page indicating the most recently tested version and the author's contactability, eg 'No support available', 'Bug fixes only', 'Ongoing development'

For example, the Confluence Console at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Confluence+Console has apparently been abandoned by the author for over 18 months.
fields.summary: Test and depreciate dead third-party plugins from CAC

fields.description:
Umbrella issue that should be linked to everything where we would want to monitor Confluence status and/or push notifications to administrators.

The reasoning behind this is that most major organizations will have some kind of monitoring tooling which they can finetune to send mails to administrators, send text messages (sms), or even call administrators at 3AM in the night. It would great if we could incorporate all our important status into a page that can be monitored by such tools, in order not to replicate all of this functionality into Confluence (e.g. sending mails, text, or even making phonecalls at night)
fields.summary: Add a status page that can be monitored by Nagios et. al, and which displays vital internal Confluence details
News calendar is not properly localized
Adjustable profile picture size

fields.description: When an XWork plugin is loaded, it adds itself as a configuration provider. When it is _activated_, it reloads the XWork configuration. If there is a class referenced in its config that is not available at activation time, XWork will fail to reload with a RuntimeException, but it WILL NOT remove the configured plugin. As such, any future XWork that tries to activate itself will die with the same error.
fields.summary: XWork plugin load failure can cause subsequent XWork plugins to be unloadable

fields.description: Currently, the 500 page shows a lot of information, but only parts of it (like the stacktrace) show up in the log. Since users might close the window, the information gets lost. It might be retrievable later on, but the system might have changed by then (e.g. the bug was due to a unsupported plugin, but by the time the customer sends a support request, he might have disabled the plugin and forgotten about it).

fields.description:
Users need the ability  to add attachments without Watchers being sent e-mails for each one - something like the  "minor change" checkbox that is available in the Edit Page function.  

Issue Conf-2219 currently scheduled for 2.7, enables adding attachments at the time a page is created.  However, the parallel situation often occurs when a page is edited or when a sequence of attachments is being added.  The person adding the attachments should get to choose whether the addition is significant enough (or distinct enough) for a separate e-mail to go out.
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments to a page without sending notifications to watchers
panel macros {note}, {tip}, etc do not export to pdf properly with icon=false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9360].
  {panel}

These groups have some special functionality, and administrators might not realise that they're special. It would be good to pop up a warning of some kind before letting them be removed.

In particular, these groups do the following:

- confluence-users: all users created through the admin screen or public signup are added to this group by default; when creating a space, granting permisions to 'logged-in users' means this group
- confluence-administrators: all users in this group have permission checks skipped, allowing them to see otherwise inaccessible spaces and "rescue" spaces that have become inaccessible to normal users.

Note that Confluence can still be administered and operated normally if these groups are removed. The warning is purely to stop people removing these groups unless they understand what they're doing.
fields.summary: Warn before deleting confluence-administrators or confluence-users group

Kind regards,
Rick Cogley
fields.summary: Cannot Disable User

fields.description:
All users are getting "Not Permitted" message displayed when they login to wiki. Only users who are part of confluence-administartors group can get to it

When a pound '#' sign is added in users network Id, personal spaces for these kind of users are having an issue. The space permissions for these users do not indicate any problems at all. When a level permission is being changed for one of these users in personal space, a *null* SpaceId is added to *SpacePermissions* table and hence causing problems with authorization requests for all users except confluence-administrators. 

Only upon deleting of the culprit NULL record from the SpacePermissions table and restarting of application things start working again.


Proposition:
* Prevent NULLs to be created in the SpacePermissions table
* Allow for users with profile starting with '#' in relation to personal spaces
* Rollback the changes if the records deleted but subsequent inserts failed due to update of permissions
fields.summary: Problems when usernames or group names contain pound signs/hashes (#)

- like metadata-reports and pagetreesearch, navmaps should be able to be used for a given label but for a sub-section of a space as defined by a parent/child heirarchy.

See also

- group by space: CONF-6457

fields.description:
Note: This problem has already been fixed in the latest Confluence documentation i.e. DOC and CONF256 spaces. But the fix needs to be applied also in archived Confluence spaces:
* CONF25
* CONF20

Duplicate entries are occurring in some lists of links e.g. FAQ, related topics, etc.

Cause: we have recently archived the Confluence documentation to space CONF25, and copied the User Guide from CONF20 to DOC. This means that, potentially, a single label can exist in two or even three spaces.

Fix: Confine the contentbylabel macro to a single space, by adding parameter "key=@self".

To find the culprits, do a search for "contentbylabel NOT key=@self" in the DOC space.
fields.summary: Confine contentbylabel macros to current space in archived Confluence spaces (CONF25, CONF20)

fields.description:
'd like to report critical vulnerabilities in 3 of your macros - Column, Image, Block and Code macros.

The vulnerabilities are classified as XSS Type 2 (stored) and the details with example exploits are in the pdfs attached.

Because of similarity of the vulnerabilities assume that it is more than likely that more of your, as well as contributed plugins suffer from exactly the same problem.

The fix for all the macros is very simple, just make sure that all the user input (should it be input via body of the macro, or macro attributes) that gets injected into html is encoded or escaped.

No user input should be allowed to be interpreted as a html element or attribute (or css in the case of the Code macro). Some suggest sanitizing the input by replacing characters like "/\>< with a space or something similar, but such a approach is error-prone and can break usability of your products, so I suggest that you stick with encoding the output into html entities when creating the output. Atlassian has multiple utility methods that can be used for this. Check out GeneralUtil for example. (http://docs.atlassian.com/com/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/util/GeneralUtil.html)

Every single vulnerability should be rated as critical, because these macros can be exploited by users having write access to wiki pages, or even by users having access to creating comments. Possible exploits can lead to stealing protected information and user passwords, changing user profiles, vandalizing wiki content or even DoS attacks.

BTW I looked at your JIRA issue tracker, but there is no way to submit bug reports like this without exposing them to the world. Your documentation suggests, creating an JIRA issue and setting the visibility to developers and reporter only, but this feature is not available at jira.atlassian.com

Just keep in mind that the macros that I mentioned in this tickets are only 4 out of 5 macros that I tried to break. Due to time constraints I didn't test the rest of the macros, but I hope that you'll do so because I'm sure that there are more vulnerabilities in those macros.

btw the Dynamic Task macro v2 (the new one) is also vulnerable, I reported that to Jonathan Nolen

I also found multiple vulnerabilities in Create Page macro from Adaptavist. I reported the issue to Alain Moran via email.
fields.summary: Numerous XSS Type 2 vulnerabilities in macros bundled with Confluence
Improvements to camel case linking

fields.description:
When entering the first character into the {livesearch} search box, an exception is thrown, which is displayed in the results area of the macro (it is the standard "A system error has occurred - our apologies! " error message). After entering the second character everything is normal and I can see the usual list of matches.

The confluence website is very large, probably a few hundred MByte of text. I tried the same {livesearch} macro on confluence.atlassian.com and it does not throw an exception even though I think your site has even more text.

The installed Confluence release is 2.5.3, but it is heavily modified. It is fully possible that this problem is caused by missing or modified properties, or by other side effects of the customisation. However I am not sure how to attack this problem.

My guess so far is: On entering the first character, for example an "e", the lucene search attempts to execute a "e*" wildcard search which returns so many matches that some limit is exceeded. But then why does this not happen on confluence.atlassian.com which should also have a large number of matches for this particular search?

Is there a way to start the search only after at least two characters have been entered?

Maybe the livesearch JavaScript code is supposed to suppress such exceptions, but the code does not work as expected in our environment, the error message is not suppressed but displayed to the user.

fields.description:
I used the social bookmarking plugin a lot, and it appears that each bookmark appears as a separate page in the index.

In my case I was half-lucky because all my bookmarks start with the same letter, but imagine someone bookmarking a hundred random sites. 

See screenshot
fields.summary: Bookmarks appear as pages in alphabetical view

fields.description:
I have reproduced this bug on my local test instance.

Steps for reproducing this problem:

1) Ensure that the "Anonymous" access has been enabled for the space and a few permissions have been assigned to this user.
2) Remove the "View" permission of an "Individual User" - this will cause this individual user to be removed from the list of "Individual Users"
3) Save All

Notice that all permissions assigned to the "Anonymous" user are lost.

I've tried this on Firefox 2.0.0.6 and the customer who has reported this problem has also been able to reproduce it on Safari 2.0.4.
fields.summary: Removing the "View" permission for an "Individual User" within a space, causes loss of all assigned permissions of  Anonymous user
The date link on the left nav theme doesn't have tooltip for perm link

fields.description:
Probably discussed it already but anyway

It's not particular clear what the sort order of the "Recently Updated" is. I assume it's by most recent first, and grouped by some time period, but there's no way to know this for sure.

There seems to be room underneath the date for the actual time of the update (or the latest update time for a group of changes). The area is blank (due to the icon size) and maybe we can have a low contrast font colour so that it doesn't generate too much noise.

Anyway feel free to close if this has been done to death already
fields.summary: Include tImestamp on the "Recently Updated" section on Dashboard
